## Figure captions
Figure 1 — Most Harmful Weather Events (Population Health)
This figure displays the top 10 weather event types ranked by total injuries and fatalities. Tornadoes, excessive heat, and flooding show the greatest population health burden.

Figure 2 — Most Common Weather Events in the U.S.
This chart highlights the most frequently occurring weather event types across the country, showing that thunderstorm wind and hail events are among the most common.

Figure 3 — Monthly Trends of Top Weather Events
This line plot shows how the five most frequent event types vary across months. Severe convective events peak during late spring and summer, while winter storms increase during colder months.

Figure 4 — Deadliest Events by Fatality Rate
This figure presents the event types with the highest fatalities per event. Rare but severe hazards—such as avalanches and rip currents—show the highest fatality rates.
